subject: RE: [junit] J2EEUnit or JUnitEE - What to use?
msgSnippet: All the servlet does is call test classes (which DO use JUnit) and dump the results out to an HTML page.  The servlet itself doesn t do any asserts or logging.
messageBody:
All the servlet does is call test classes (which DO use JUnit) and dump the
results out to an HTML page. The servlet itself doesn't do any asserts or
logging.


-dmg

-----Original Message-----
From: Andy Kriger [mailto:akriger@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 15, 2001 2:13 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] J2EEUnit or JUnitEE - What to use?


Does your code use JUnit in the context of Weblogic or are you using your
own test result assertions and logging?
-----Original Message-----
From: David M. Goudreau [mailto:david_goudreau@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 15, 2001 5:01 PM
To: JUnit Mailing List
Subject: [junit] J2EEUnit or JUnitEE - What to use?


Does anyone have any opinions on which on is better / more robust / etc...?
Actually, I'm wondering if we need to move to one of them at all. Currently
we have a servlet in place on our WebLogic server which lets us execute
whatever test class we want in the context of the WebLogic server and spits
out the results to an HTML page. Do J2EEUnit or JUnitEE do the same thing
or alot more? What we have at the moment is pretty bare-bones but it works
fine. Thanks in advance.


-dmg
